#Text=Create a Long Term Care Plan
#Text=Financial security today and in the future is what most of us aim for .
#Text=However , no matter how carefully you plan , your finances and quality of life can still crumble if you are unprepared for long-term care .
#Text=Long-term care planning involves going through a myriad of concerns , but the process becomes more bearable if you know what steps you need to take .
#Text=With this guide , start planning for long-term care today and involve your family in doing so .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Know your needs .
#Text=Nobody can say for sure what your long-term care needs will be , but there are several ways to help you have a forecast .
#Text=Look at your present health situation .
#Text=Do you have a current condition ?
#Text=Are you in any risk of incurring illness or injury because of your lifestyle or job ?
#Text=At the same time , look into your family 's health background ?
#Text=Are you susceptible to certain health conditions that run in your bloodline ?
#Text=As you think about these factors , you can consult your doctor so that you 'll have a better assessment of your possible long-term care needs in the future .
#Text=Explore different care options .
#Text=Long-term care can come from different sources and can be administered in different settings .
#Text=Learn what these are , determine what 's available to you , and decide which among the options you prefer most .
#Text=In most cases , loved ones and family members become the main providers of care when a long-term care event takes place .

#Text=Though they usually assume the role of caregivers out of love and concern , you also need to consider how this situation can affect their job , income , relationships and overall quality of life .
#Text=Meanwhile , long-term care can also be provided by professionals .
#Text=Depending on the level of care needed , care services can be administered in the home , assisted living facilities , adult day care centers , or nursing homes .
#Text=Learn about the cost of care in your area .
#Text=As you create a plan , make sure that you 're familiar with how much long-term care costs in the area where you intend to receive care .
#Text=This will help you gauge how much you need for care-related expenses .
#Text=The cost of different care services and settings vary from state to state .
#Text=For instance , the median annual cost of a private room in a nursing home in Florida is $ 96,725 , whereas in South Carolina , the annual average is only at $ 75,008 .
#Text=Determine how you 're going to cover care expenses .
#Text=Care-related expenses can be covered in different ways .

#Text=You can opt for self-insurance and pay from your own pocket , purchase long-term care insurance or hybrid products like life insurance or annuities with long-term care coverage , or seek assistance from Medicaid .
#Text=Each payment option has its own sets of pros and cons .
#Text=You need to carefully examine these alongside your financial situation to know which is most suitable for you .
#Text=Asking the help of a professional can help you in doing so .
#Text=Create the necessary documents .
#Text=Advance directives such as a health care power of attorney and living will should also be part of your long-term care plan .
#Text=These documents are essential because they will serve as your mouthpiece should you become unable to decide and speak for yourself .
#Text=A health care power of attorney states the name of the person who will be responsible for making health care related decisions for you when you can no longer do so .
#Text=Meanwhile , living will is a document that contains your wishes , preferences , and requests when it comes to medical treatment and health care .
